Kate Baker

468 Bronte Road · Bronte, NSW 2024 · 0481 579 175 · katevb2@gmail.com

An experienced educator with excellent communication and interpersonal skills who is keen to career-switch to a role in front-end development. Knowledgeable in HTML, CSS, Bootstrap 5 and Javascript and participated in projects with Code First Girls, including reaching the finals in a UX/UI Accessibility challenge.

Projects

Web Accessibility Challenge

Code First Girls

Brandwatch partnered with CFG to create a UX Challenge with the brief: improve the accessibility of a website. Perform an accessibility audit of a website then design and build a more accessible site in a week.

August - September 2022

Our audit provided the starting point for our discussions on how to improve the site accessibility. Guided by user personas we analysed how the design succeeded (high contrast colours, clean aesthetic) and how we could improve (increasing font-size, reducing clutter on the navigation bar and bringing the newsletter into focus). As the sole website developer and with such limited time, I decided to use a w3schools template to build the demo site.

Difficulties
  • Understanding how to manipulate the template.
  • Keeping communication clear when the team are working on different schedules.
  • Time pressure.
Learnings
  • Importance of mobile-first, responsive design.
  • WW3 Schools, Github Community and Stack Overflow have probably solved your problem before - find it.
  • Keep your code clean.

Project Outcome

Out of over 20 teams, the judges ranked us in the top 3 and we were asked to present our project to the sponsor Brandwatch at the final meeting. We were all proud of what we achieved in a short time-frame and it was a successful ending to a exciting project. I received positive feedback for the website development from my teammates, with Lucia C.S saying "Tremendous job you have done! Many congratulations. I really admire your work and your patience".

I also received two certificates, one for passing the course on UX/UI Accessibility Design and one for completing the team accessibility project.

Intro to Web Development

Code First Girls

Over the course of 8 weeks I learnt HTML, CSS and Javascript and progressed from building a basic 'About Me' page to working in a team of 5 to build a website on the theme 'Sustainability'.

July - August 2022

We used Slack and Zoom to communicate and after deciding to create a website about sustainable materials we got to work dividing up tasks. I developed the homepage, the navigation bar with a drop down menu, embedded video from Youtube and added a photo carousel. As we were a team of beginners, we had to learn how to work collaboratively on code using Github. We learned how to communicate clearly about exactly what we were working on and when we had pushed code, in order to reduce crossover.

Difficulties
  • Putting Javascript theory into action.
  • Learning how to position and centre elements.
  • Correcting discrepencies in CSS.
Learnings
  • How to work collaboratively on Github.
  • Keep communication at the forefront to avoid duplicating tasks.
  • How to use HTML, CSS and Javascript for a multi-page website.

Project Outcome

We successfully finished the project on time and presented it to our course leaders in the final meeting. I loved being a part of a team challenge and gained not just technical experience, but the knowledge of how to work on a project remotely. I received a certificate for passing the Introduction to Web Development course.

Interests

I love reading but find it hard to keep the momentum up when life gets busy, so at the start of this year I set myself the challenge of reading 20 books. Keeping a list of the books I have read so far is helping to keep me focused, click on the books below to see my list so far. Another love of mine is travelling. After studying languages at university I knew I wanted to see more of the world and have been lucky enough to live and work in France, Italy, New Zealand and America, and to visit many other spots. On my recent journey from London to Sydney I made use of a long stop-over to visit Thailand, Singapore and Borneo. Now that I'm over this side of the world I am hoping to explore all the Aussie highlights and hopefully visit Japan.

I have also linked one of my favourite language learning podcasts, my go-to online yoga teacher who does excellent short videos when you need a little relaxation and lastly a QR code to what used to be my favourite way to waste time.
